intro: Galium homblei, commonly known as Hombli's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems.
